docs.snippet: The case of Curtis Baushke, who was knocked unconscious three times in 14 years while playing soccer, highlights the risks beyond boxing and football....
docs.lead_paragraph: The case of Curtis Baushke, who was knocked unconscious three times in 14 years while playing soccer, highlights the risks beyond boxing and football.
docs.abstract: Researchers determine that Curtis Bauske, young soccer player who died of accidental overdose of prescription drugs, had Stage 2 chronic traumatic encephalopathy, degenerative brain disease linked to concussions; Bauske's death highlights risk to athletes in any contact and collision sport.

headline.main: An Athlete Felled by Concussions, Despite Playing a ‘Safer’ Sport
headline.print_headline: Playing a Safer Sport, and Paying the Price

docs.snippet: SurveyMonkey’s executives have had to navigate the process of replacing Mr. Goldberg, while running a company on the cusp of significant growth — and managing the emotions of 550 employees....
docs.lead_paragraph: SurveyMonkey’s executives have had to navigate the process of replacing Mr. Goldberg, while running a company on the cusp of significant growth — and managing the emotions of 550 employees.
docs.abstract: Leaders at SurveyMonkey are faced with challenge of replacing chief executive Dave Goldberg, who died in May, while keeping their 550 employees focused on work at hand; death of Goldberg, who was married to Facebook chief operating officer Sheryl Sandberg, led to other Silicon Valley firms quickly approaching employees about leaving company.

headline.main: How SurveyMonkey Is Coping After the Death of Dave Goldberg
